This part will discuss the steps needed to prevent and control communicable and

Communicable Diseases
Tuberculosis (TB)This is a disease caused by a germ which 
can affect any part of the body such as 
lungs, intestines, bones and joints, glands or reproductive organs (uterus) in women. TB of the lungs can be transmitted to others as the 
patient has the germ in the sputum, which, 
if transmitted to anyone in close contact, will result in the person being infected with TB lungs as well.
